param.name: fix.external.refs.com.oxygenxml
param.desc: The DITA Open Toolkit usually has problems processing references that point to locations outside of the processed DITA Map directory. This parameter is used to specify whether or not the application should try to fix such references in a temporary files folder before the DITA Open Toolkit is invoked on the fixed references. The fix has no impact on your edited DITA content.

param.name: clean.output
param.desc: The parameter to specify whether or not to clean the output directory before each build.

param.name: args.debug
param.desc: Specifies whether or not debugging information is included in the log.

param.name: args.draft
param.desc: Specifies whether or not the content of <draft-comment> and <required-cleanup> elements is included in the output. Corresponds to the DRAFT parameter found in most XSLT modules. Tip: For PDF output, setting the args.draft parameter to yes causes the contents of the <titlealts> element to be rendered below the title.

param.name: args.figurelink.style
param.desc: Specifies how cross references to figures are styled in output. Specifying NUMBER results in "Figure 5"; specifying TITLE results in the title of the figure. Corresponds to the FIGURELINK parameter in XSLT. Note: Support for PDF was added in DITA-OT 2.0.

val.desc: Supported starting with DITA-OT 2.0 by the PDF output.

param.name: args.filter
param.desc: Specifies a filter file to be used to include, exclude, or flag content.

param.name: args.grammar.cache
param.desc: Specifies whether or not the grammar-caching feature of the XML parser is used. Note: This option dramatically speeds up processing time. However, there is a known problem with using this feature for documents that use XML entities. If your build fails with parser errors in regards to entity resolution, set this parameter to no.

param.name: args.input
param.desc: Specifies the master file for your documentation project. Typically this is a DITA map. However, it can also be a DITA topic if you want to transform a single DITA file. The path can be absolute, relative to args.input.dir, or relative to the directory where your project"s Ant build script resides if args.input.dir is not defined.

param.name: args.input.dir
param.desc: Specifies the base directory for your documentation project. The default value is the parent directory of the file specified by args.input.

param.name: args.logdir
param.desc: Specifies the location where the DITA-OT places log files for your project.

param.name: args.rellinks
param.desc: Specifies which links to include in the output.

val.desc: No links are included
All links are included
Parent, child, next, and previous links are not included.

param.name: args.tablelink.style
param.desc: Specifies how cross references to tables are styled. Specifying NUMBER results in "Table 5", while specifying TITLE results in the title of the table. Corresponds to the TABLELINK parameter in XSLT. Note: Support for PDF was added in DITA-OT 2.0. By default, PDF uses the value NUMTITLE, which is not supported for other transform types (this results in "Table 5. Title").

val.desc: Supported starting with DITA-OT 2.0 by the PDF output.

param.name: clean.temp
param.desc: Specifies whether or not the DITA-OT deletes the files in the temporary directory after it finishes a build.

param.name: dita.dir
param.desc: Specifies where the DITA-OT is installed.

param.name: dita.temp.dir
param.desc: Specifies the location of the temporary directory. The temporary directory is where the DITA-OT writes temporary files that are generated during the transformation process.

param.name: dita.input.valfile
param.desc: Specifies a filter file to be used to include, exclude, or flag content. Note: Deprecated in favor of the args.filter parameter.

param.name: generate.copy.outer
param.desc: Specifies how to deal with overflowing dita/topic files.

val.desc: Only generate/copy files that fit within the designated output directory.
Generate/copy all files, even those that will end up outside of the output directory.
The old solution, to adjust the input.dir according to the referenced files (this option was kept only for backward compatibility purposes).

param.name: onlytopic.in.map
param.desc: Specifies whether or not files that are linked to, or referenced with a @conref attribute, should generate output.

val.desc: Only files that are referenced directly from the map will generate output

param.name: outer.control
param.desc: Specifies how the DITA-OT handles content files that are located in or below the directory containing the master DITA map. Warning: Microsoft HTML Help Compiler cannot produce HTMLHelp for documentation projects that use outer content. Your content files must reside in or below the directory containing the .ditamap file, and the map file cannot specify ".." at the start of href attributes for topicref elements.

val.desc: Fails quickly if files are going to be generated/copied outside of that directory
Completes if files will be generated/copied outside, but logs a warning
Quietly finishes with only those files and does not generate warnings or errors.

param.name: output.dir
param.desc: Specifies the name and location of the output directory. By default, the output is written to DITA-dir\out.

param.name: transtype
param.desc: Specifies the output format. Each DITA-OT plugin can register a new output format.

param.name: validate
param.desc: Specifies whether or not the DITA-OT validates the content.

param.name: dita.ext
param.desc: Specifies an extension to use for DITA topics. All DITA topics will use this single extension in the temp directory. Corresponds to the DITAEXT parameter in XSLT.

param.name: generate-debug-attributes
param.desc: Specifies whether or not the @xtrf and @xtrc debugging attributes are generated in the temporary files.

val.desc: Enables generation of debugging attributes
Disables generation of debugging attributes

param.name: processing-mode
param.desc: Specifies how the DITA-OT handles errors and error recovery.

val.desc: When an error is encountered, the DITA-OT stops processing
When an error is encountered, the DITA-OT attempts recovery
When an error is encountered, the DITA continues processing but does not attempt error recovery

param.name: args.artlbl
param.desc: Specifies whether to generate a label for each image. The label will contain the name of the image file.

param.name: args.breadcrumbs
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate breadcrumb links.

param.name: args.copycss
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to copy the custom CSS file to the output directory.

param.name: args.css
param.desc: Specifies the file path of a custom CSS file.

param.name: args.csspath
param.desc: Specifies the location of a copied CSS file relative to the output directory. Corresponds to the CSSPATH parameter in XSLT.

param.name: args.cssroot
param.desc: Specifies the directory that contains the custom CSS file. DITA-OT will copy the file from this location.

param.name: args.dita.locale
param.desc: Specifies the language locale file to use for sorting index entries. Note: This parameter is not available for the XHTML transformation.

param.name: args.ftr
param.desc: Specifies an XML file that contains content for a running footer. Corresponds to the FTR parameter in XSLT. Note: The XML file must contain valid XML content. A common practice is to place all content into a <div> element.

param.name: args.gen.default.meta
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate extra metadata that targets parental control scanners, meta elements with name="security" and name="Robots". Corresponds to the genDefMeta parameter in XSLT.

param.name: args.gen.task.lbl
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate headings for sections within task topics. Corresponds to the GENERATE-TASK-LABELS parameter in XSLT.

param.name: args.hdf
param.desc: Specifies an XML file that contains content to be placed in the document head.

param.name: args.hdr
param.desc: Specifies an XML file that contains content for a running header. Corresponds to the HDR parameter in XSLT. Note: The XML file must contain valid XML. A common practice is to place all content into a <div> element.

param.name: args.hide.parent.link
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to hide links to parent topics in the HTML or XHTML output. Corresponds to the NOPARENTLINK parameter in XSLT. Note: This parameter is deprecated in favor of the args.rellinks parameter.

param.name: args.indexshow
param.desc: Specifies whether or not the content of <indexterm> elements are rendered in the output.

param.name: args.outext
param.desc: Specifies the file extension for HTML or XHTML output. Corresponds to the OUTEXT parameter in XSLT.

param.name: args.xhtml.classattr
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to include the DITA class ancestry inside the XHTML elements. For example, the <prereq> element (which is a specialization of the section element) would generate class="section prereq". Corresponds to the PRESERVE-DITA-CLASS parameter in XSLT. Note: Beginning with DITA-OT release 1.5.2, the default value is yes. For release 1.5 and 1.5.1, the default value was no.

param.name: args.xsl
param.desc: Specifies a custom XSLT file to be used instead of the default XSLT transformation file (xsl\dita2xhtml.xsl). The parameter must specify a fully qualified file name.

param.name: args.rellinks
param.desc: Specifies which links to include in the output.

val.desc: No links are included
All links are included

param.name: args.bookmap-order
param.desc: Specifies if the order of frontmatter and backmatter content is retained in bookmap.

param.name: args.bookmark.style
param.desc: Specifies whether or not PDF bookmarks are by default expanded or collapsed.

param.name: args.chapter.layout
param.desc: Specifies whether or not chapter level TOCs are generated.

param.name: args.fo.userconfig
param.desc: Specifies the user configuration file for the FO processor.

param.name: args.gen.task.lbl
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate headings for sections within task topics. Corresponds to the GENERATE-TASK-LABELS parameter in XSLT.

param.name: args.xsl.pdf
param.desc: Specifies an XSLT file that is used to override the default XSLT transformation file (plugins\org.dita.pdf2\xsl\fo\topic2fo_shell.xsl). You must specify the fully qualified file path.

param.name: custom.xep.config
param.desc: Specifies the user configuration file for RenderX.

param.desc: Specifies the XSLT processor.

Apache FOP

param.name: publish.required.cleanup
param.desc: Specifies whether or not draft-comment and required-cleanup elements are included in the output. The default value is the value of the args.draft parameter. Corresponds to publishRequiredCleanup parameter in XSLT.

param.name: xep.failOnError
param.desc: Signals XEP that it should fail on an error.

param.name: retain.topic.fo
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to retain the generated FO file. If the configuration property org.dita.pdf2.use-out-temp is set to false, this parameter is ignored.

param.name: org.dita.pdf2.use-out-temp
param.desc: Legacy temporary file mode for generating topic.fo and graphics into the output directory.

val.desc: Use output directory for XSL FO file processing
Use tempory folder for XSL FO processing

param.name: show.changes.and.comments
param.desc: Show Oxygen track changes and comments

param.name: args.xhtml.contenttarget
param.desc: Specifies the value of the @target attribute on the <base> element in the TOC file.

param.name: args.xhtml.toc
param.desc: Specifies the base name of the TOC file.

param.name: args.xhtml.toc.class
param.desc: Specifies the value of the @class attribute on the <body> element in the TOC file. Found in map2htmltoc.xsl.

param.name: args.htmlhelp.includefile
param.desc: Specifies a file that you want included in the HTML Help.

param.name: htmlhelp.locale
param.desc: Global encoding for CHM output pages.

param.name: args.htmlhelp.default.topic
param.desc: The path of the default topic that will be opened the first time in the CHM output, relative to the base output directory (for example: topics\\intro.html).

param.name: args.css.output.dir
param.desc: Specifies the directory for the CSS files in EPUB and Kindle transformations. By default it is the configured topic output directory.

param.name: cover.graphic.file
param.desc: Specifies the absolute or relative path of the image (JPEG, PNG, or GIF) to use as the cover graphic for the EPUB.

param.name: d4p.max.nav.depth
param.desc: Specifies the maximum navigation depth of the table of contents. The default is the value of the d4p.max.toc.depth parameter (which has a default value of "5").

param.name: d4p.max.toc.depth
param.desc: Specifies the maximum depth of the generated HTML table of contents.

param.name: topics.output.dir
param.desc: Specifies the name of the output directory.

param.name: epub.exclude.auto.rellinks
param.desc: Excludes auto-generated related links. Set this value to true to suppress related links in the output. Note that explicitly-authored related links are not affected. You cannot change the default value to true because this is a global property that affects all transformation types.

val.desc: related links are generated

param.name: epub.pubid.uri.stub
param.desc: Specifies the URI prefix to use in constructing the full EPUB ID value in the EPUB metadata. If this is a relative URI it should end with a "/" character. This parameter normally identifies the organization that owns or publishes the EPUB (for example "http://mydomain.com/EPUB").

param.name: epub.temp.dir
param.desc: Specifies the directory to use for EPUB-specific processing. This is different from the main Toolkit temp directory. An absolute platform-specific filename. This directory holds all the files that are then zipped to create the final EPUB file. By default temporary EPUB files are stored in a directory called "epub_temp" within the defined Toolkit temp directory.

param.name: images.output.dir
param.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all images. Any valid directory name. The EPUB process automatically renames graphics to ensure that there are no name conflicts when the graphics are copied to into this directory from their source locations.

param.name: args.odt.img.embed
param.desc: Determines whether images are embedded as binary objects within the ODT file.

param.name: args.javahelp.map
param.desc: The root file name of the output javahelp map file in javahelp transformation. The default is the name of input ditamap file.

param.name: args.javahelp.toc
param.desc: Specifies the name of the file containing the TOC in your JavaHelp output. Default value is the name of the ditamap file for your project.

param.name: helpset.name
param.desc: The name of the helpset file which will be generated. If not specified it will be composed from the DITA Map file name and optionally the specified DITAVAL filter file (if there is a DITAVAL file specified).

param.name: args.dita.locale
param.desc: The locale used for sorting indexterms. If no locale specified, the first occurrence of "xml-lang" will be used as default locale; If no "xml-lang" found, "en-us" will be used by default. The JavaHelp transformation type also uses this parameter.

param.name: args.eclipsehelp.toc
param.desc: Specifies the name of the TOC file. The default is the name of input ditamap file.

param.name: args.eclipsehelp.country
param.desc: Specifies the region for the language that is specified by the args.eclipsehelp.language parameter. For example, us, ca, and gb would clarify a value of en set for the args.eclipsehelp.language parameter. The content will be moved into the appropriate directory structure for an Eclipse fragment.

param.name: args.eclipse.language
param.desc: Specifies the base language for translated content, such as en for English. This parameter is a prerequisite for the args.eclipsehelp.country parameter. The content will be moved into the appropriate directory structure for an Eclipse fragment.

param.name: args.eclipse.provider
param.desc: Specifies the name of the person or organization that provides the Eclipse help. Tip: The toolkit ignores the value of this parameter when it processes an Eclipse map.

param.name: args.eclipse.version
param.desc: Specifies the version number to include in the output. Tip: The toolkit ignores the value of this parameter when it processes an Eclipse map.

param.name: args.eclipse.symbolic.name
param.desc: Specifies the symbolic name (aka plugin ID) in the output for an Eclipse Help project. The @id value from the DITA map or the Eclipse map collection (Eclipse help specialization) is the symbolic name for the plugin in Eclipse. Tip: The toolkit ignores the value of this parameter when it processes an Eclipse map.

param.name: helpset.name
param.desc: The name of the helpset file which will be generated. If not specified it will be composed from the DITA Map file name and optionally the specified DITAVAL filter file (if there is a DITAVAL file specified).

param.name: args.eclipse.provider
param.desc: The provider name of the eclipse help output. Tip: The toolkit ignores the value of this property when processing an Eclipse Collection Map, eclipse.dtd.

param.name: args.eclipse.version
param.desc: The version number of the eclipse help output. Tip: The toolkit ignores the value of this property when processing an Eclipse Collection Map, eclipse.dtd.

param.name: args.eclipsecontent.toc
param.desc: Specifies the name of the TOC file. The default is the name of input ditamap file.

param.name: kindlegen.executable
param.desc: File path to the kindlegen executable. e.g. "/Users/ekimber/apps/KindleGen_Mac_i386_v1.1/kindlegen".

param.name: html2.generate.dynamic.toc
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a dynamic TOC in the output.

param.name: html2.generate.frameset
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate an HTML frameset file for the map.

param.name: html2.generate.static.toc
param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a static TOC in the output

param.name: graphviz.dot.executable
param.desc: File path to the Graphviz dot executable. e.g. "C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Graphviz2.32\\bin\\dot.exe".

param.name: output.file
param.desc: The parameter to specify the output JavaScript file for TOCJS.

param.name: content.frame
param.desc: The parameter to specify the content frame for TOCJS.

param.name: args.fo.img.ext
param.desc: The extension name of image file in pdf transformation. Note: Only one extension supported in the same transformation, image files with other extensions will be renamed to the specified extension.

param.name: args.fo.output.rel.links
param.desc: The parameter to specify whether output related links in pdf transformation. If ${args.fo.include.rellinks} is specified, this parameter is ignored.

param.name: args.fo.userconfig
param.desc: The parameter to specify the user configuration file for FOP.

param.name: args.artlbl
param.desc: Specifies whether to generate a label for each image; the label will contain the image file name.

param.name: title.only.topic.class.spec
param.desc: Specifies the @class attribute value to use for title-only topics generated from topicheads.

param.name: title.only.topic.title.class.spec
param.desc: Specifies the @class attribute value to use for title-only topics generated from topicheads.

param.name: html2.file.organization.strategy
param.desc: Names the output file organization strategy to use for generated files. One of the pre-defined strategies or a user-implemented name. If the strategy name is not recognized (that is, not handled by the base code or an extension) then the default strategy is applied. The default is dependent on the specific transformation type. For HTML2 the default is "as-authored". For EPUB it is "single-dir".
